successDesc:
The whirling spiral slows down,
showing forgiveness.

Reverence for a being of no significance
is followed by a slight self-contempt.

The spiral descended out of sight in the meantime.
failureDesc:
Though you turned away, it keeps pulling you in.
As if drawn by a magnet,
all eyes are pulled toward it.

The spiral has not forgiven.
Contempt for your hesitation to show the courage not to face it takes over.

You feel the encroaching spiral slowly dig its way in.

successDesc:
We carefully walked into the dense fog.
Eerie howls surround us.

It was no longer possible to tell which way was forward.
All we could do was keep walking.

The fog cleared at one point,
and a trinket of endless ashen flow awaited us.

We then realized it wasn’t fog we walked through.
failureDesc:
We carefully walked into the dense fog.
Eerie howls surround us.

It was no longer possible to tell which way was forward.
All we could do was keep walking.
After a while, even advancing began to feel terrifying.

The fog grows thicker.
It feels as though you will no longer be able to escape.

successDesc:
You stared into the eye-like things.
Your piercing gaze met the song
of endless despair and wailing sockets.

You then realized that it wasn’t fog you were facing.
What you thought were its eyes and mouth
all turned out to be tricks played by shadows.

When you figured out that its howl was merely whistling wind,
all of it vanished.
failureDesc:
You stared into the eye-like things.
It returned the gaze, singing endless despair.

Just as you felt that the figure seemed to have grown,
we were engulfed by the fog.

successDesc:
With each rope that’s untied, the wail grows louder.

You feel sympathy for the trapped being.

Undoing the ropes, you begin to weep
along with their wailing.

One undone knot accompanies sorrow.
One undone knot accompanies lamentation.

When the last is released,
you discover that there is no one inside.

Perplexed, you examine the interior,
and find a single, red-jeweled beetle.
failureDesc:
With each rope that’s untied, the wail grows louder.

There’s more than one individual occupying the coffin.
Several people are clinging to each other, all crying.

The coffin bursts open, letting them out.

dataList.behaveDesc: Let’s just go back. Who should lead the way?
successDesc:
The red arms wave in the air,
as if pleading not to be left behind.

But, after another look,
it also seems as if they’re thankful for being left as they are.

Though the wailing hasn’t ceased,
the weeping seems to have softened, just a little.
failureDesc:
You disregard the chilling sensation and move on.

However, that feeling would linger,
even after a while of walking.

At one point, you stopped and turned around
to find a hand.

It was attached to an unnaturally scrawny red arm.

It grabbed its speechless victim.
A familiar note was added to the coffin’s wailing.

successDesc:
“You kent that?”

The paper flapped in disbelief.

“Well, if you really insist, knowing what’s coming…”

It took a step back, dousing itself with coffee.
Just then, a paper soldier
suddenly rushed at you.

“You shouldn’t underestimate paper’s integrity.”

Before you could respond to the peculiar voice,
the soldier attacked you.
failureDesc:
“You sure you read it right?”

“With a body like that, you can’t fulfill the contract written here!”

The paper sprayed coffee on the floor,
spewing insults.

Before we could make any excuses,
we got kicked out.

successDesc:
“‘Preciate it. You made the job easier.”

The paper soldiers nearby
start fighting each other.

Sometime later, the defeated soldiers’ bodies are torn,
exploding into paper cranes.

One of the cranes crawls your way.

“Take good care of that piece.”

The satisfied sheet of paper drenched itself in coffee.
failureDesc:
“That your way of turning someone down?”

Annoyed, the paper crumpled.

“There are basics to proper conversation.
I don’t wish to speak with someone
who can’t respect those basics.”

Before we could make any excuses,
we got kicked out.

successDesc:
You removed the nails from the teddy bear.

Bloody pus pours out of the holes.

Once the plush had finished its copious exudation,
only a dark cavity remained within.

It is an empty void.
failureDesc:
The nails plunged into its chest were buried deep.

Nothing would budge even after several tugs and pulls.
It’s all firmly lodged in the cotton base.

The plush looks down at it
as if nothing is happening.

Perhaps it’s unable to feel pain.

successDesc:
You picked up the ring in its hand.
It remains perfectly still, maintaining its chant.

This statue won’t move,
no matter what happens around it.

Though it stays forever still,
and the tone of its mantra remains consistent…

You knew one thing.

Its chants are imbued with a curse.
failureDesc:
You tried to pick up the ring in its hand.
Its wrist suddenly spun in a circle.

You reach for the ring again,
but that wrist keeps moving, denying you.

It could be conveying that you are unworthy.

successDesc:
Its growl recedes.

You stroke it once more,
and it closes its eyes, pleased.

You stroke it once more,
and it settles on the ground, comforted.

You stroke it once more,
and it shrinks to become a statue.
failureDesc:
When you reach out to pet it,
it growls louder.

When your finger touched its bristled fur,
it jumped, yelping violently.

You try to approach it as it gives you a fierce glare,
but it runs off without turning back.

What else should you have done?

successDesc:
When you detached one,
a candle in the room suddenly began to burn.

With another detached,
the fire burns even brighter.

The wooden doll begins
to tremble ever so slightly.

Is it right to continue?

Is this what it wishes for?
failureDesc:
Nothing happened.
The doll would simply stand there, producing small noises.

The talismans in hand have turned into sticky blood,
slipping between your fingers.

successDesc:
It’s a tablet of unknown letters.

While you’re unable to fully grasp it,
a few words stand out.

Judgement…
Retribution…
Punishment…

You also see some combinations of words
that might have deadly consequences if you try to understand them.

When you look back up, the scribe gives a short nod
before soaring into the sky.
failureDesc:
It’s a tablet of unknown letters.

You feel you might be able to understand it.
It just needs a little more effort.

A little more… Just a little more…

When you come to your senses, the being has disappeared.
You were left alone with the tablet in your hands.

successDesc:
You pick a rose out of it.

With closer examination, you notice
that it has an intestinal texture.

What is a flower-shaped organ for?
failureDesc:
You pick a rose out of it.

Your careless removal
has crushed the uniquely textured flower.

The sign shows no change.

successDesc:
You contain some of the slime in a glass jar.

This isn’t simply a mass of filth.

Numerous hatchlings swim inside.

These tiny creatures are feeding on each other;
could they be the clam’s offspring?
failureDesc:
You approach with a glass jar in hand.

However, hesitation takes hold, and you eventually turn around.

You couldn’t stand the thought
of reaching out to contain that filth.

In fact, you get the feeling that it’s something you mustn’t hold.

successDesc:
As you head for the giant flower,
the smaller ones make way.

They close up their petals as you pass,
as if to bow down in respect.

Once you arrived at the end,
the giant flower drooped low to offer a present.
failureDesc:
You head for the giant flower.

The small blooming ones scuttle and shuffle.

They seem to be staring from all directions.
You feel like you might get lost.

Looking back up,
the giant flower still waves to you.

You couldn’t approach the flower no matter what you tried.

All you could do was gaze at it from a distance.

A sudden wave of nostalgia prompts you to wave.

In an instant, all the flowers went awash with red,
simultaneously turning to face you.

After staring into us for a little while,
their red petals flew at us.

It was like a punishment for making a half-hearted gesture.

successDesc:
As soon as it’s shown where to go,
it runs in that direction.

You notice it dropped something as it began to sprint.

A blue lighter with a Wing’s logo on it.

You heard stories of that Wing
providing its employees with supplies like this.

It would seem that it was an employee of the transport company, not a passenger.
failureDesc:
While you were in contemplation,
it slowly shambled your way.

When you point in a random direction out of panic,
it changes course to follow the instruction.

Moments later,
you heard the noise of metal plates crumpling, and something else ripping apart.

successDesc:
You quickly ducked out of its path.

Its arms obsessively grope around for you.

Fortunately, it could only reach so far,
and we safely made our escape.
failureDesc:
You quickly ducked out of its path.

However, it was no easy task
to avoid its obsessive hands.

A few of them managed to grab and scratch at us.

Though we managed to escape, we suffered a lot.

successDesc:
It lifts a nearby object
to carry it from left to right.

The count on its body went up by 1.

Just as you started to wonder if that was it,
the machine replaced one of its vacuum tubes with a new one.

It presented the old one to you,
and naturally, you accepted.
failureDesc:
It lifts a nearby object
to carry it from right to left.

While it was moving the object,
it suddenly came to a halt.

The vacuum tubes in its body suddenly flicker.

After flashing random letters and numbers,
everything shut off.

With its power gone, the object slipped from its hands and fell.
…A few of us were standing in the impact zone.

successDesc:
“Apply stimulation and pain to the centipede
to increase the discharge intensity.”

So writes a message above the buttons.

When you pressed the drop-shaped button, the tank was filled with water.

The centipede twists its body as if in some sort of dance.

It didn’t seem to be out of joy.
failureDesc:
“Apply stimulation and pain to the centipede
to increase the discharge intensity.”

So writes a message above the buttons.

When you pressed the drop-shaped button, the tank was filled with water.

The centipede twists its body as if in some sort of dance.

You watched the centipede’s tail scratch the tank’s surface. 
The glass cracked and fell apart immediately afterward.

The electrified water fell right on our heads.

successDesc:
"Aha, good! Here, have a drink."

It feels as though a hard, burning liquid is rampaging around the body.

"Mmm, I like the way you drink it!"

A steadily floating sensation is followed by the feeling that you're in better shape somehow.

"Feeling the magic at work? This is what we call medicinal booze! Go on then, go for another shot!"

After a few more shots of the liquor, we left the place with gleeful steps.
failureDesc:
"Aha, good! Here, have a drink."

It feels as though a hard, burning liquid is rampaging around the body.

"Hey... You alright?"

A sudden nausea is followed by the view slowly turning to the right.

"A real shame... It's such a good drink... but I guess your body doesn't agree with it. You should stop drinking it."

Trying to hold the eyes and head that were starting to spin faster, we left in a hurry.

The way out might have been accompanied by bumps and slams into walls, but even that blurred out of memory.

successDesc:
The laughing skull was lifted.

Elated for whatever reason, it keeps clattering its teeth and wobbling on the hands.

All of a sudden, you feel your body getting lighter.

Looking around, you notice that everyone seems to be experiencing the same thing.

When you looked back at the hands, the skull disappeared before you could notice.
failureDesc:
The laughing skull was lifted.

Strangely enough, the skull's expression suddenly turned blank as soon as it was held.

Wondering what might be the problem, the Sinner moved their head closer to the skull, and...

"?!"

The skull opened its jaws wide and bit {0} before disappearing.

successDesc:
The angry-looking skull was lifted.

Upset for whatever reason, it clattered its teeth as if it was trying to bite something in the air.

All of a sudden, the hands felt lighter.

"Is this..."

The skull vanished into thin air, and a glowing object was left on the hands.
failureDesc:
The angry-looking skull was lifted.

Strangely enough, the skull's expression suddenly turned blank as soon as it was held.

Wondering what might be the problem, the Sinner moved their head closer to the skull, and...

"?!"

The skull opened its jaws wide and bit {0} before disappearing.

successDesc:
The skull with a bizarre expression was lifted.

As if driven crazy, it rolled around and clattered its teeth without any rhyme or reason to it.

Just as you started to be unsure of what to do with it, the hands felt lighter, so you looked down...

And found that it turned into a tiny trinket.
failureDesc:
The skull with a bizarre expression was lifted.

Strangely enough, the skull's expression suddenly turned blank as soon as it was held.

Wondering what might be the problem, the Sinner moved their head closer to the skull, and...

"?!"

The skull opened its jaws wide and bit {0} before disappearing.

successDesc:
"How do I comfort a droplet..."

As odd as the order sounds, the Sinner does their best to lift its spirits.

The droplet seems to have perked up thanks to the Sinner's efforts.

"I could be free thanks to you."

It feels as though the droplet said something like that.

Soon enough, the droplet disappeared from view, and an object that looked like a big glass container was left in the place.
failureDesc:
"How do I comfort a droplet..."

As odd as the order sounds, the Sinner does their best to lift its spirits.

Alas... it didn't seem to help the droplet shake off its gloomy mood.

"Thanks anyways, this is for your trouble."

It feels as though the droplet said something like that.

The droplet handed us half of itself, and disappeared in the blink of an eye.

Seeing as the Sinners are saying they're feeling refreshed, its half must have been a gift.

successDesc:
It's only right to put it back where it belongs.

The droplet is lifted and pushed into the giant glass container.

And we watched.

We watched the face of the droplet being filled with terror, contempt, anger, and loathing as it slid down the tube.

"You shouldn't have done that."

"We might have looked like one in your eyes. But to me, this is hell."

It felt like it told us such things.

Along with the glass container, we could hear something within our hearts crack.
failureDesc:
It's only right to put it back where it belongs.

The droplet is lifted and pushed into the giant glass container.

And we watched.

We watched the face of the droplet being filled with terror, contempt, anger, and loathing as it slid down the tube.

"...Ahh!"

While we were distracted by the face, the droplet bounced off and slid out of view.

...Maybe it was something we shouldn't have done.

successDesc:
We told the person that the things in their hands are just blue marbles.

"Is that so. That's how you see them."

The person remained tranquil as if they knew you'd tell them that.

"If you want to look at them that way, then I say go ahead."

They disappeared, gently waving the marbles.

It feels like we've learned an important truth.
failureDesc:
We told the person that the things in their hands are just blue marbles.

"You sound pretty confident. Do you know what a star is in the first place?"

"Speckles of light floating in the dark. That's what we call stars."

They gently wave the marbles in their hands.

"Stars are what's in your mind. So these blue marbles are stars."

As the upright manner of speech was about to be etched on the heart, they disappeared, telling us they'll 'go to the blue star'.

It feels like we've learned an important truth.

successDesc:
Seeing the numerous hues of light in them, they ought to be stars for sure.

"I want to return to the blue star someday."

Could that be where they come from? Will I be able to go there?

"Do you think so too? That you want to return to that place."

You nod. You have no idea where it may be, and you certainly aren't from it, but you feel the urge to go back to it.

"Then I'll give this to you."

They handed over a blue star they were holding and disappeared.
failureDesc:
Seeing the numerous hues of light in them, they ought to be stars for sure.

"Right, but..."

Their tone suddenly changes to a melancholic one.

"I know. That I can't go back to it anymore."

"That I'm just waving my arms and emitting the blue glow to become a star myself."

With a whistling noise, it vanished into thin air.

Our heads somehow felt lighter after this.

successDesc:
It was focused on its prayers.

Doing your best to ignore the rotting stench, you manage to take a prayer book off its body.

It's so deeply immersed that it doesn't notice us approach it and take the booklet at all.

Perhaps its faith was too deep for prayer books to hold any meaning.

Whatever beliefs and doctrines it follows, they would already be firmly rooted in its mind and heart.
failureDesc:
It was focused on its prayers.

Doing your best to ignore the rotting stench, you manage to take a prayer book off its body.

"Gieeegh?!"

Was our attempt noticed? As soon as the booklet was removed, an unpleasant noise bursts out.

We braced ourselves for possible attacks, but it didn't seem to care about us.

It scraped the ground with its mandible, writing something down.

...It seemed to be the content of the prayer book.

successDesc:
While it stood still, we carefully approached it.

If we remove a part of it, those bound to it might find momentary peace.

"...!"

Taking off a piece of the wire was surprisingly easy.

However, the flesh lumps show no change at all.

It's as though they are telling us that this won't be remotely sufficient to free them from what they suffered that day.
failureDesc:
While it stood still, we carefully approached it.

If we remove a part of it, those bound to it might find momentary peace.

"...!"

We weren't familiar enough with the wire's structure. The hand twists and gets dragged into the wire in an instant.

"G-Get it out, quickly!"

The arm was pulled out thanks to the help of several people, but it was left severely mangled.

successDesc:
Was it by pity or some kind of sympathy?

Or was it the idea that sharing the pain might reduce their burden?

Drops of blood fall from the tip of the hand and seep into the flesh, little by little.

The thing finally responds, approaching as if to look down on you.

Maybe it saw me as the same as those who perished in the thick fog.

When it opened its mouth with a pitiful look, a glowing object was inside.

It might be a small token of consolation it's offering. You took the object.
failureDesc:
Was it by pity or some kind of sympathy?

Or was it the idea that sharing the pain might reduce their burden?

Drops of blood fall from the tip of the hand and seep into the flesh, little by little.

"...Urk!"

All corpses and bodies bound to the wire scream at once.

The thing begins to rampage in unison.

As I was not part of the war nor I was there to witness it, I cannot associate with or understand them in any way.

It was merely a fit of hasty arrogance.

There was no choice but to flee from the place, leaving the raging thing behind.

successDesc:
The O-ring snaps rather easily. It might have been weakened by age.

"Kff, kurgh..."

As Enkephalin pours out of the box, we face the person bloated and drenched with the substance through the glass window on the box.

Knowing that it is no longer human, sympathy causes a hand to be offered.

"Put it away."

It spoke.

"This was the only choice I had. To survive..."

"We were buried here with no hopes of rescue. We've been abandoned."

"I... We shoved our heads into Enkephalin so that we can endure the time."

The explanation is then followed by resentment.

"Why are you trying to save us after all this time? I want nothing more than to dip my head into that green water right now!"

Its face was full of anger, it ran off with the empty box still on its head.

All that it left was a small employee card and the guilt of doing what shouldn't have been done.
failureDesc:
Was the ring sturdier than it seemed, or was it the lack of skill?

The blade kept bouncing off the slippery O-ring...

"Brgrrgh..."

And the submerged thing pushed you away and ran off.

Did it prefer to stay like that?

All it left was a small employee card.

successDesc:
"Ah..."

You moved your leg to the side and pointed below, to the trembling apple's dismay.

"Hah, got you."

"No! I don't want this!"

"Stories must follow their natural courses. This is the flow we shall follow, so accept it."

It picked up the tiny apple and put it on the back of the horse.

"This won't be needed anymore. It's not the most flattering gift, but I will give it to you as a reward for letting me know."
failureDesc:
Just as you thought you'd tell the truth, you felt a tremor at your leg.

"...You were hiding it."

You try to deny it, but it was already angered.

"Get lost!"

It lashes at you viciously with a thorny snare...

And when you managed to dodge the onslaught, you found that the snare caught the rotten apple.

"This is the natural course. Accept it."

Having caught the apple, it ran off in the other direction.

successDesc:
I command death to it.

"...Your command is understood. A great sense of purpose was detected in your voice."

"The command shall be carried out."

It disappeared after the short reply.

Soon enough, a loud noise rang from a distance.

...Then, the body felt lighter and invigorated.
failureDesc:
I command death to it.

"...Your command is understood. However-"

"I do not detect any sense of purpose in your voice. You are speaking without knowing why the command is to be made."

"You will be punished for giving meaningless commands."

Before a word could be said, the hand on its tail comes forth.

successDesc:
I command life to it.

"...Your command is understood. A great sense of purpose was detected in your voice."

"The command shall be carried out."

It disappeared after the short reply.

Soon enough, brisk steps could be heard.

As the footsteps went over the head, a shining thing fell from above.

...Could this be their thanks?
failureDesc:
I command life to it.

"...Your command is understood. However-"

"I do not detect any sense of purpose in your voice. You are speaking without knowing why the command is to be made."

"You will be punished for giving meaningless commands."

It took away the glowing things that had been collected.

successDesc:
I did not give it any command.

"None can go without giving any commands."

Watching its tail sway menacingly, we hastily waved our hands and gave an excuse.

"...Your command is understood. I now see what you meant."

Could something we said have elicited a response?

"The command shall be carried out."

It placed a mysterious object before leaving.
failureDesc:
I did not give it any command.

"None can go without giving any commands."

Watching its tail sway menacingly, we hastily waved our hands and gave an excuse.

"You have additionally committed the crime of neglecting to command even yourself."

"The crime of neglecting that obligation will be punished rightly."

The improvised excuse didn't work, and the tail was swung our way in a large arc.

successDesc:
Did you place it with sincerity?

Then the wish may come true.
failureDesc:
To place your wish on top of countless others...

The hand needed to be lighter and more cautious.

One stone falls to the ground, followed by many others.

The price for ruining the tower won't be light.

dataList.behaveDesc: Who will bring down the cairn?
successDesc:
You see something buried beneath the collapsed cairn.

We may never know why it had to be buried discreetly.
failureDesc:
As the stones collapsed in such a short time,

You attempted to avoid them to no avail, being pressed under their weight.

Now you were the one trapped in the stone cairn.

successDesc:
Declining the offer, we pressed on in the rain.

While running, you noticed something in your hand.

Perhaps it's the serendipity of staying out of that umbrella.
failureDesc:
'Oh dear... They're being spoiled...'

The tall fairy runs at us with jovial motions, holding the umbrella still.

It reveals a concealed arm stained with blood. It was running in a hurry, and the long arm is stretched toward us, trying to snatch us by the neck.

successDesc:
'Alright, then let's keep the festival going.'

The secret festival raged on in the field of battle where bullets rain.

After watching it for a while, you snuck out of the place, taking medical supplies dropped on the ground.

The sounds of bullets continued until you left.
failureDesc:
'Right, if you're gonna stay quiet...'

'Then it must mean you remember and will continue to remember.'

'Let me do you a favor.'

'The people you love will remember you as yet another victim that lost their head.'

This is still a battlefield;

The shooter loads its bullets with expertise.

successDesc:
The intravenous line was removed from its body.

When the red line was pulled out, its body regained vigor as if relieved of some kind of curse.

Perhaps the line was siphoning its nutrition rather than supplying it.
failureDesc:
The intravenous lines were too intricately intertwined to pull out.

While digging through the knots, you feel a sting on your hand.

You look down to find that a needle was poking into the back of your hand.

You quickly pulled it out, but you felt dizzy for some reason.

successDesc:
'It will be the newest patient of our hospital.'

'This is a small garden and haven.'

'They will be on good terms with the other patients.'

'It won't hurt; the anesthetics are plenty.'

We suffered many wounds on the way here, big and small.

Whether it's the body or the mind, wounds need to be treated in time.

If it's allowed to develop into a scar, it will not go away for certain.
failureDesc:
Even the most skilled doctor can't turn every operation into success.

So it's natural for failure to be present even with multiple of them.

What can we do about it?

We'll have to bear the pain and limp our way back, as we always have.

successDesc:
The flask on the back fills with red.

Sated by the weight of the blood, the head lifts from the floor and points to the ceiling again.
failureDesc:
Alas, more blood was spilled than expected.

You fall to the floor as if you became the hammer.

Sated by the weight of the blood, the head lifts from the floor and points to the ceiling again.

successDesc:
Trying to lightly remove it is like brushing off dust

Is an affront to the greed that refused to dissipate even after shoving the head into it.

There was no choice but to watch as the hand reached out.
failureDesc:
We thought we pulled it out, but couldn't move forward.

Seeing it grasp at coattails until the end, you're sapped of strength, bound by the dreadful tenacity.

successDesc:
To hug is to embrace another.

The fingers that were stretched to grasp things clasp with another's appendages for the first time.

Between the quietly laced appendages, there was a warmth of blood beginning to circulate.

Like that, the rigid greed loosens.
failureDesc:
It seems the basic manners of clearing sweat from the hand before extending it for a handshake were neglected.

Your hand slipped, and the emptied palm wriggles as if to seek another left hand to grasp.

However, it no longer tries to recklessly grab things, seemingly fulfilled by the attempt.
